result.execSummary:
The defendant Keagan J Beier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Cost to be paid within 90 days. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment. 

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keagan J Beier

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keagan J Beier in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Atty Guza states that victim wishes to make a statement via phone. Atty Guza provides phone number. Clerk attempts to call, call goes to VM. 

Defendant enters a plea of guilty to sole count. Court finds the defendant guilty of the charge. 

Victim appears by phone and presented statements to the Court. 

The state makes sentencing recommendation. Atty Guza makes sentencing recommendation. The Defendant makes statements. 


Court orders the following:	
Fine:  $379.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid in full in 90 days. 
Alternate: entry of civil judgment
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant to have no contact with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:08 AM Defendant Keagan J Beier in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Keagan J Beier

Prior: 636 Beaus Boy #3, Slinger, WI 53086
